direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grimsrud has a crowbar jammed in between the bathroom door and frame, and is working it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jean crosses to a high window above the toilet and throws it open.  Snow that had drifted against the window sifts lightly in.  Jean steps up onto the toilet. The door creaks, moving as one piece in its frame. Jean glances back as she steps up from the toilet seat to the tank. The groaning of the door ends with the wood around its knob splintering and the knob itself falling out onto the floor. The door swings open. Grimsrud and Carl enter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Room empty, window open. Carl strides to the window and hoists himself out. Grimsrud opens the medicine cabinet and delicately taps aside various bottles and tubes, seeking the proper unguent. He finds a salve but after a moment sets it down, noticing something in the mirror. The shower curtain is drawn around the tub. He steps toward it. As he reaches for the curtain, it explodes outward, animated by thrashing limbs. Jean, screaming, tangled in the curtain, rips it off its rings and stumbles out into the bedroom.  Grimsrud follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jean rushes toward the door, cloaked by the shower curtain but awkwardly trying to push it off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still thrashing, Jean crashes against the upstairs railing, trips on the curtain and falls, thumping crazily down the stairs. Grimsrud trots down after her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: :  WADE GUSTAFSON INCORPORTATED INT. WADE'S OFFICE Wade sits behind his desk; another man rises as Jerry enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How ya doin' there, Stan?  How are ya, Wade? Stan Grossman shakes his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good to see ya again, Jerry.  If these numbers are right, this looks pretty sweet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, those numbers are all right, bleemee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is do-able.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Congratulations, Jerry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yah, thanks, Stan, it's a pretty -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What kind of finder's fee were you looking for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...  Huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The financials are pretty thorough, so the only thing we don't know is your fee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...  My fee?  Wade, what the heck're you talkin' about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stan and I're okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're good to loan in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But we never talked about your fee for bringin' it to us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, but, Wade, see, I was bringin' you this deal for you to loan me the money to put in.  It's my deal here, see? Wade scowls, looks at Stan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jerry - we thought you were bringin' us an investment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yah, right -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're sayin' - what're you sayin'?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're sayin' that we put in all the money and you collect when it pays off?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no.  I - I'd, I'd - pay you back the principal, and interest - heck, I'd go - one over prime -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not a bank, Jerry. Wade is angry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the heck, Jerry, if I wanted bank interest on seven hunnert'n fifty thousand I'd go to Midwest Federal.  Talk to Bill Diehl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's at Norstar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's at -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, see, I don't need a finder's fee, I need - finder's fee's, what, ten percent, heck that's not gonna do it for me.  I need the principal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jerry, we're not just going to give you seven hundred and fifty thousand dollars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the heck were you thinkin'? Heck, if I'm only gettin' bank interest, I'd look for complete security.  Heck, FDIC.  I don't see nothin' like that here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yah, but I - okay, I would, I'd guarantee ya your money back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not talkin' about your damn word, Jerry.  Geez, what the heck're you?...  Well, look, I don't want to cut you out of the loop, but his here's a good deal. I assume, if you're not innarested, you won't mind if we move on it independently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are high and wide on the office building's parking lot. Jerry emerges wrapped in a parka, his arms sticking stiffly out at his sides, his breath vaporizing.  He goes to his car, opens its front door, pulls out a red plastic scraper and starts methodically scraping off the thin crust of ice that has developed on his windshield. The scrape-scrape-scrape sound carries in the frigid air. Jerry goes into a frenzy, banging the scraper against the windshield and the hood of his car. The tantrum passes.  Jerry stands pantin, staring at nothing in particular. Scrape-scrape-scrape - he goes back to work on the windshield.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A beat, silent but for a key scraping at the lock. The door swings open and Jerry edges in, looking about, holding a sack of groceries.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hon? He shuts the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...  Got the growshries... He has already seen the shower curtain on the floor.  He frowns, pokes at it with his foot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...  Hon?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jerry walks in.  He sets the groceries down on the toilet tank. He looks at the open window, through which snow still sifts in.  He shuts it. He picks up the small tube of uguent that sits on the sink, frowns at it, puts it back in the medicine chest. He looks at the shower curtain rod holding empty rings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Once again we are looking at the rumpled shower curtain. From another room:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yah, Wade, I - it's Jerry, I. Then, slightly more agitated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...  Yah, Wade, it's, I, it's Jerry... Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...  Wade, it's Jerry, I - we gotta talk, Wade, it's terrible... Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jerry stands in wide shot, hands on hips, looking down at a telephone. After a motionless beat he picks up the phone and punches in a number.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...  Yah, Wade Gustafson, please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold in black. A slow tilt down from night sky brings the head of a large paper-mache figure into frame.  It is a flannel-shirt woodsman carrying a double-edged ax over one shoulder.  As we hear the rumble of an approaching car, the continuing tilt and boom down brings us down the woodsman's body to a pedestal. A sweep of headlights illuminates a sign on the pedestal:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - HOME OF PAUL BUNYAN. The headlights sweep off and a car hums past and on into the background.  The two-lane highway is otherwise empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl drives.  Grimsrud smokes and gazes out the window. From the back seat we hear whimpering. Grimsrud turns to look. Jean lies bound and curled on the back seat underneath a tarpaulin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut the fuck up or I'll throw you back in the trunk, you know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Geez.  That's more'n I've heard you say all week. Grimsrud stares at him, then turns back to the window. At a loud WHOOP Carl starts and looks back out the rear window.  Fifty yards behind a state trooper has turned on his gumballs. Carl eases the car onto the shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, shit, the tags... Grimsrud looks at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...  It's just the tags.  I never put my tags on the car.  Don't worry, I'll take care of this. He looks into the back seat as the car bounces and slows on the gravel shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...  Let's keep still back there, lady, or we're gonna have to, ya know, to shoot ya. Grimsrud stares at Carl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...  Hey!  I'll take care of this! Both cars have stopped.  Carl looks up at the rear-view mirror. The trooper is stopped on the shoulder just behind them, writing in his citation book. Carl watches. We hear the trooper's door open. The trooper walks up the shoulder, one hand resting lightly on top of his holster, his breath steaming in the cold night air. Carl opens his window as the trooper draws up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How can I help you, officer? The trooper scans the inside of the car, taking his time. Grimsrud smokes and gazes calmly out his window. Finally:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a new car, then, sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It certainly is, officer.  Still got that smell!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're required to display temporary tags, either in the plate area or taped inside the back window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Certainly -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I see your license and registration please?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Certainly. He reaches for his wallet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...  I was gonna tape up the temporary tag, ya know, to be in full compliance, but it, uh, it, uh ... must a slipped my mind... He extends his wallet toward the trooper, a folded fifty- dollar bill protruding from it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...  So maybe the best thing would be to take care of that, right here in Brainerd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's this, sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's my license and regis- tration.  I wanna be in compliance. He forces a laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...  I was just thinking I could take care of it right here.  In Brainerd. The policeman thoughtfully pats the fifty into the billfold and hands the billfold back into the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put that back in your pocket, please. Carl's nervous smile fades.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...  And step out of the car, please, sir. Grimsrud, smiling thinly, shakes his head. There is a whimpering sound. The policeman hesitates. Another sound. The policeman leans forward into the car, listening. Grimsrud reaches across Carl, grabs the trooper by the hair and slams his head down onto the car door. The policeman grunts, digs awkwardly for footing outside and throws an arm for balance against the outside of the car. With his free hand, Grimsrud pops the glove compartment.  He brings a gun out and reaches across Carl and shoots - BANG - into the back of the trooper's head. Jean screams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up. He releases the policeman. The policeman's head slides out the window and his body flops back onto the street. Carl looks out at the cop in the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whoa...  Whoa, Daddy. Grimsrud takes the trooper's hat off of Carl's lap and sails it out the open window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll take care of it.  Boy, you are smooth smooth, you know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whoa, Daddy. Jean, for some reason, screams again.  Then stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clear him off the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. He gets out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl leans down to hoist up the body. Headlights appear:  an oncoming car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grimsrud notices.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The car approaches, slowing. Carl, with the trooper's body hoisted halfway up, is frozen in the headlights. The car accelerates and roars past and away.  We just make out the silhouettes of two occupants in front.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grimsrud slides into the driver's seat.  He squeals into a U- turn, the driver's door slamming shut with his spin. Small red tail lights fishtail up ahead.  The pursued car churns up fine snow. Grimsrud takes the cigarette from his mouth and stubs it in his ashtray.  We hear the churning of the car wheels and the pinging of snow clods and salt on the car's underside. In the back seat, Jean starts screaming. Grimsrud is not gaining on the tail lights. He fights with the wheel as his car swims on the road face. The red tail lights ahead start to turn.  With a distant crunching sound, they disappear. The headlights now show only empty road, starting to turn. Grimsrud frowns and slows. His headlights show the car up ahead off the road, crumpled around a telephone pole, having failed to hold a turn. Grimsrud brakes. Jean slides off the back seat and thumps into the legwell. Grimsrud sweeps his gun off the front seat, throws open his door and gets out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The wrecked car's headlights shine off into a snowfield abutting the highway.  A young man in a down parka is limping across the snowfield, away from the wrecked car. Grimsrud strides calmly out after the injured boy.  He raises his gun and fires. With a poof of feathers, a hole opens up in the boy's back and he pitches into the snow. Grimsrud walks up to the wreck and peers in its half-open door. A young woman is trapped inside the twisted wreckage, injured. Snow swirls in the headlights of the wreck. Grimsrud raises his gun and fires.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A blue-winged teal in flight over a swampy marshland.  The room in which it hangs is dark.  We hear off-screen snoring. We track off to reveal an easel upon which we see a half- completed oil of a grey mallard. The continuing track reveals a couple in bed, sleeping.  The man, fortyish, pajama-clad, is big, and big-bellied.  His mouth is agape.  He snores.  His arms are flung over a woman in her thirties, wearing a nightie, mouth also open, not snoring. We hold for a long beat on their regular breathing and snoring. The phone rings. The woman stirs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, geez... She reaches for the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...  Hi, it's Marge... The man stirs and clears his throat with a long deep rumble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...  Oh, my.  Where?...  Yah... Oh, geez... The man sits up, gazes stupidly about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...  Okay.  There in a jif... Real good, then. She hangs up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...  You can sleep, hon.  It's early yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gotta go?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yah. The man swings his legs out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll fix ya some eggs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's okay, hon.  I gotta run.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gotta eat a breakfast, Marge. I'll fix ya some eggs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aw, you can sleep, hon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ya gotta eat a breakfast... He clears his throat with another deep rumble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...  I'll fix ya some eggs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aw, Norm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leavings of a huge plate of eggs, ham, toast. Wider, we see Marge now wearing a beige police uniform.  A patch on one arm says BRAINERD POLICE DEPARTMENT.  She wears a heavy belt holding a revolver, walkie-talkie and various other jangling police impedimenta.  Norm is in a dressing gown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks, hon.  Time to shove off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Love ya, Margie. As she struggles into a parka:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Love ya, hon. He is exiting back to the bedroom; she exits out the front door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dawn.  Marge is making her way down the icy front stoop to her prowler.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Norm sits back onto the bed, shrugging off his robe.  Off- screen we hear the front door open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marge stamps the snow off her shoes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hon?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yah?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Prowler needs a jump.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two police cars and an ambulance sit idling at the side of the road, a pair of men inside each car. The first car's driver door opens and a figure in a parka emerges, holding two styrofoam cups.  His partner leans across the seat to close the door after him. The reverse shows Marge approaching from her own squad car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hiya, Lou.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Margie.  Thought you might need a little warm-up. He hands her one of the cups of coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yah, thanks a bunch.  So what's the deal, now?  Gary says triple homicide?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yah, looks pretty bad.  Two of'm're over here. Marge looks around as they start walking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is everybody?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well - it's cold, Margie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Laid out in the early morning light is the wrecked car, a pair of footprints leading out to a man in a bright orange parka face down in the bloodstained snow, and one pair of footsteps leading back to the road. Marge is peering into the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, geez.  So...  Aw, geez. Here's the second one...  It's in the head and the ... hand there, I guess that's a defensive wound.  Okay. Marge looks up from the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...  Where's the state trooper? Lou, up on the shoulder, jerks his thumb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Back there a good piece.  In the ditch next to his prowler. Marge looks around at the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, so we got a state trooper pulls someone over, we got a shooting, and these folks drive by, and we got a high-speed pursuit, ends here, and this execution-type deal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd be very surprised if our suspect was from Brainerd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yah. Marge is studying the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yah.  And I'll tell you what, from his footprints he looks like a big fella - Marge suddenly doubles over, putting her head between her knees down near the snow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ya see something down there, Chief?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh - I just, I think I'm gonna barf.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Geez, you okay, Margie?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm fine - it's just morning sickness. She gets up, sweeping snow from her knees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...  Well, that passed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yah?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yah.  Now I'm hungry again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You had breakfast yet, Margie?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, yah.  Norm made some eggs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yah?  Well, what now, d'ya think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go take a look at that trooper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marge's prowler is parked nearby. Marge is on her hands and knees by a body down in the ditch, again looking at footprints in the snow.  She calls up to the road:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's two of 'em, Lou!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yah?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yah, this guy's smaller than his buddy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, yah?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the foreground is the head of the state trooper, facing us.  Peering at it from behind, still on her hands and knees, is Marge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For Pete's sake. She gets up, clapping the snow off her hands, and climbs out of the ditch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's it look, Marge?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, he's got his gun on his hip there, and he looks like a nice enough guy.  It's a real shame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You haven't monkeyed with his car there, have ya?

direction.raw_text: No way. She is looking at the prowler, which still idles on the shoulder.

direction.raw_text: Somebody shut his lights.  I guess the little guy sat in there, waitin' for his buddy t'come back.

direction.raw_text: Yah, woulda been cold out here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heck, yah.  Ya think, is Dave open yet?

direction.raw_text: You don't think he's mixed up in -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no, I just wanna get Norm some night crawlers.

direction.raw_text: Marge is driving; Lou sits next to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You look in his citation book?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yah... He looks at his notebook.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...  Last vehicle he wrote in was a tan Ciera at 2:18 a.m. Under the plate number he put
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - I figure they stopped him or shot him before he could finish fillin' out the tag number.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh-huh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So I got the state lookin' for a Ciera with a tag startin' DLR. They don't got no match yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not sure I agree with you a hunnert percent on your policework, there, Lou.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yah?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yah, I think that vehicle there probly had dealer plates.  DLR?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh... Lou gazes out the window, thinking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...  Geez.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yah.  Say, Lou, ya hear the one about the guy who couldn't afford personalized plates, so he went and changed his name to J2L 4685?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yah, that's a good one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The police car enters with a whoosh and hums down a straight- ruled empty highway, cutting a landscape of flat and perfect white.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jerry, Wade, and Stan Grossman sit in a booth, sipping coffee.  Outside the window, snow falls from a gunmetal sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -  All's I know is, ya got a problem, ya call a professional!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!  They said no cops!  They were darned clear on that, Wade!  They said you call the cops and we -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, a course they're gonna say that!  But where's my protection? They got Jean here!  I give these sons a bitches a million dollars, where's my guarantee they're gonna let her go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, they -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A million dollars is a lot a damn money!  And there they are, they got my daughter!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yah, but think this thing through here, Wade.  Ya give 'em what they want, why wont' they let her go? You gotta listen to me on this one, Wade.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heck, you don't know!  You're just whistlin' Dixie here!  I'm sayin', the cops, they can advise us on this!  I'm sayin' call a professional!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!  No cops!  That's final!  This is my deal here, Wade!  Jean is my wife here!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I gotta tell ya, Wade, I'm leanin' to Jerry's viewpoint here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We gotta protect Jean.  These - we're not holdin' any cards here, Wade, they got all of 'em.  So they call the shots.

direction.raw_text: You're darned tootin'!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, dammit!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm tellin' ya.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well...  Why don't we... He saws a finger under his nose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...  Stan, I'm thinkin' we should offer 'em half a million.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now come on here, no way, Wade! No way!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not horse-trading here, Wade, we just gotta bite the bullet on this thing.

direction.raw_text: Yah!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the next step here, Jerry?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're gonna call, give me instructions for a drop.  I'm supposed to have the money ready tomorrow.

direction.raw_text: Dammit!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She rings up two dollars forty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How was everything today?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yah, real good now.

direction.raw_text: Snow continues to fall.  Jerry and Stan stand bundled in their parkas and galoshes near a row of beached vehicles. Wade sits behind the wheel of an idling Lincoln, waiting for Stan.

direction.raw_text: Okay.  We'll get the money together. Don't worry about it, Jerry.  Now, d'you want anyone at home, with you, until they call?

direction.raw_text: No, I - they don't want - they're just s'posed to be dealin' with me, they were real clear.

direction.raw_text: Yah. Jerry pounds his mittened hands together against the cold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ya know, they said no one listenin' in, they'll be watchin', ya know. Maybe it's all bull, but like you said, Stan, they're callin' the shots.

direction.raw_text: Yah, geez, Scotty.  I'll go talk to him. There is a tap at the horn from Wade, and Stan gets into the Lincoln.

direction.raw_text: Marge pulls her prowler over some distance past the cabin. She gets out, zips up her khaki parka and pulls up its fur- lined hood. For a moment, she stands listening to the muffled roar of the power tool.  Then, with one curved arm half pressing against, half supporting her belly, she takes slow, gingerly steps down the slope, through the deep snow, through the trees angling toward the cabin and the source of the grinding noise. She slogs from tree to tree, letting each one support her downhill-leaning weight for a moment before slogging to the next. The roar grows louder.  Marge stands panting by one tree, her breath vaporizing out of her snorkel hood.  She squints down toward the cabin's back lot. A tall man with his back to us, wearing a red plaid quilted jacket and a hunting cap with earflaps, is laboring over a large power tool which his body blocks from view. Marge advances. The man is forcing downward something which engages the roaring power tool and makes harsh spluttering noises. The man is Grimsrud, his nose red and eyes watering from the cold, hatflaps pulled down over his ears.  His breath steams as he sourly goes about his work, both hands pressing down a shod foot, as it if were the shaft of a butter churn. The roar is very loud. Marge slogs down to the next tree, panting, looking. Grimsrud forces more of the leg into the machine, which we can now see sprays small wet chunks out the bottom. Marge's eyes shift. A large dark form lies in the snow next to Grimsrud. Grimsrud works on, eyes watering.  With a grunt he bends down out of frame and then re-enters holding a thick log. He uses it to force the leg deeper into the machine. Marge is advancing.  She holds a gun extended toward Grimsrud, who is still turned away. Grimsrud rubs his nose with the back of his hand. Marge closes in, grimacing. Grimsrud's back strains as he puts his weight into the log that pushes down into the machine. The dark shape in the snow next to his side is the rest of Carl Showalter's body. Marge has drawn to within twenty yards.  When she bellows it sounds hollow and distant, her voice all but eaten up by the roar of the power tool.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop!  Police!  Turn around and hands up! Startled, Grimsrud scowls.  He turns to face her. He stares. Marge bellows again:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...  Hands up! Conscious of the noise, she shows with a twist of her shoulder the armpatch insignia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...  Police! Grimsrud stares. With a quick twist, he reaches back for the log, hurls it at Marge and then starts running away. Marge twists her body sideways, shielding herself. No need - the heavy log travels perhaps ten yards and lands in the snow several feet short of her. Grimsrud pants up the hill - slow going through the deep snow. Behind him:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...  Halt! She fires in the air. She lowers the gun and carefully sighs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...  Halt! She fires. Grimsrud still slogs up the hill - a miss. Marge sights again.

direction.raw_text: ...  Halt! She fires again. Grimsrud pitches forward.  He mutters in Swedish as he reaches down to clutch at his wounded leg. Marge walks toward him, gun trained on him as her other hand reaches under her parka and gropes around her waist. It comes out with a pair of handcuffs, which she opens with a snap of the wrist.
